text: Im not sure what you mean by that
But besides that , how are you today? I hope everything went well :slightly_smiling_face: I am extremely sorry for the late reply as I have been really busy these past few days with school work

Today i went to Dungeness nuclear power station with our physics class and I have just come back , it was reaallyy enjoyable as we got to see the inside of a nuclear reactor and learnt how everything works like how electricity is made and everything about nuclear fission
This trip was really helpful for us because it will help our understanding of when we learn about this topic in a2 physics in yr 13 this September
Right now im really exhausted from all the travelling from the coach :sweat_smile:
Heres some pictures I took during my trip, unfortunately I couldn't take any inside due to security reasons:laughing:
When we arrived there
I loved the scenery on the way there
Gotta love those sheeps :joy:

That sounds like a great trip! I've been to a couple of LNG terminals (gas gets transported as a liquid, very interesting terminals that it gets imported through) but nothing quite as exciting as a nuclear plant.

My last question - I meant that I can't just tell you what the pros and cons of a particular job are. They depend on what you want out of a job - do you want lots of money and not much spare time? Do you want more spare time and are happy to trade that for less money? Do you want a simple job or a complex job? To work on your own or as part of a team? If we understand what your aims are for a job then hopefully can think about pros and cons
Ah I see , thanks a lot for answering that

What I truly want is a job which has lots of money , though just enough to support myself and my family as I dont really have ambitions for getting 10 sports cars or anything :sweat_smile: and I just want to be able to have enough time to socialise and not just spend most of my life working without having to have social life at all

So what im looking for is like a mixture of both decent money and enough time to have a social life :laughing: and at the same time a job which I also love doing and as I have told you already I love physics , so anything related to that would be great

Ok. So my job - consultant - is a trade off. The pay is good, sometimes there is a lot of work, long hours for a long time. But in general I get a decent amount of spare time, especially as I have progressed in my career.

A lot of bankers work very long hours. The pay is very good, but it can be quite stressful, depending on your exact role.

I imagine medical physics would be similar to consultant. I have a friend who works in in medical biology, well paid in the private sector and a good work/life balance. Obviously if you go through the academic route - PhD, postdoc, researcher - then the pay is a lot worse
I see , thanks so much for answering my question. So a PhD or further studies isn't always the case of getting a higher pay :sweat_smile:
It depends. If you stay in academia, no. But if you want to prove to a bank that your are highly skilled, it could be a useful route

I see, well for me I would want to get straight to working and earn more experience because a PhD will just take too long for me and I am not suited for that anyway :sweat_smile: , so I guess that works for me

Of course no matter what career it is they are times where you would have to work extra for any job , but yea if its something you enjoy doing and your getting payed well then that isn't​ something that will bother someone
Experience in work is just as valuable as a PhD
Very good point. The long hours for me are when the projects are at their most fun stage, so I don't mind at all - despite not getting overtime!
Haha good to know :grinning: :+1:
Oh I also forgot to tell you that I have also visited KPMG accounting firm last year on a trip

We were informed of apprenticeships after A levels and how we could immediately get into working towards being an accountant with all the courses that they provided and I was quite amazed and satisfied how their course structure works and how you get to try out everything on-hands in a professional environment before choosing which field to go into
Interesting. Is that instead of going from a levels to university?
My cousin is also working towards being a chartered accountant and I haven't asked her about much detail about it , but shes finished her 12-13exams and is doing her internship I believe
Yeah thats a possibility I am most likely going to consider if uni doesnt work out for me
I work with a lot of accountants, so I'm sure I can pass on any questions if you have any about it as a career path
I am still quite anxious about my AS results
Oh great , I will let you know thanks :grinning: :+1:
Have you had your exams yet?
Yup
What are you hoping for?
A's and B's
When do you find out?
But my instinct tells me below that lol
17th of August
I'm sure it'll be fine - nothing you can do now, and always better then you think
Yeah, hopefully
Its just that I am currently studying Maths, Physics, Chemistry and Computer Science
And I am studying Maths privately on my own
Great
Thats because I got a B in GCSE due to certain circumstances and I needed an A to study at school

So the maths teacher said that I need to prove It to him that I can do AS maths and get a B at least in AS by doing privately so then he can accept me next year into A2 and I really want that to happen so I can have maths phys chem as my subjects and I can drop computer science
That would be a good combination. I did those three
Oh amazing!
I love that combination because of how everything is related to each other and its just so interesting to learn about those subjects for me
I hope im not disturbing you if your busy right now :sweat_smile:

The more you study the more you will realise how everything is connected. I have done a couple of masters in philosophy, that links to maths, to physics, literature, history... the great thing (I think) about intellectual pursuits is that they really do just lead you on a never ending path
Not at all - just sitting reading for the evening
Well said, that is so really true and I believe that is the beauty of education. And im glad to know im not bugging you:grinning:

I should be going now for dinner , thanks so much for all your support and it was really awesome to have this conversation with you like this today as we are rarely online at the same time , so today is special :blush:
No trouble - happy to chat whenever I'm free
Hope your week ends well
Yours too , I will be sorting out my career plan tomorrow hopefully and I'll ask for any help if I need to , thanks as always :+1:  and take care
Ok, I should be free
Great :grinning: , byee :blush:
